verses.roman:
śareṣu hīyamāeṣu
bhajyamānesu dhanvasu
śastreṣu kṣīyamāneṣu
muṣṭibhir jahrur erakāḥ

synonyms: śareṣu—the arrows; hīyamāneṣu—as they became depleted; bhajyamāneṣu—as they became broken; dhanvasu—the bows; śastreṣu—the missile weapons; kṣīyamāneṣu—as they were used up; muṣṭibhiḥ—with their fists; jahruḥ—they seized; erakāḥ—cane stalks.
translation: When all their bows had been broken and their arrows and other missiles spent, they seized the tall stalks of cane with their bare hands.
